name: Vegan Collard Greens
description: Classic Southern Vegan Collard Greens, so flavorful you'll want to eat the whole pot! They are slow simmered to perfection in a rich broth.
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon salt, or more to taste
2 pounds collard greens, cleaned and cut (2 large bunches)
1/4 cup sun dried tomatoes, chopped, optional

recipeInstructions.text: In a large deep pot, sauté the onion in the olive oil for 5-6 minutes over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 more minute until fragrant.

recipeInstructions.text: To the pot, add the water, smoked paprika, salt and red pepper flakes. Stir and bring to a boil, then reduce heat so it's simmering gently.
recipeInstructions.name: To the pot, add the water, smoked paprika, salt and red pepper flakes. Stir and bring to a boil, then reduce heat so it's simmering gently.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped greens. Cover the pot and simmer for about an hour. They shouldn't be boiling too hard, just gently simmering on low heat. Give the greens a stir every now and then.

recipeInstructions.text: About halfway through cooking, add the vinegar and sun dried tomatoes, if using.

recipeInstructions.text: After an hour, taste and add more salt, hot sauce or any other seasonings as desired. Enjoy!
